Articles.Content:
What's up with this:

![cvrgld8.png](http://i.imgur.com/cvrgld8.png)

Phone numbers?

...well what did they say when you called them?

DONT LEAVE US HANGING, OP!

> 
> ...well what did they say when you called them?
> DONT LEAVE US HANGING, OP!

I'm not going to call them, sorry. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Phone numbers?

Unassigned in the US (said because they look like US phone numbers). Guinea-Bissau country code.
Probably just imaginary part IDs.

I just called them both, "No route to destination".

Was hoping somebody put one of the devs phone numbers in there as a joke to get a flood of calls ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

This side towards space. 

If this side starts pointing towards sun, you are not going to space today.

> 
> I just called them both, "No route to destination".
> Was hoping somebody put one of the devs phone numbers in there as a joke to get a flood of calls ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Huh, well, I wonder if it's something else? Hexidecimal decoder comes up with gibberish.

The numbers between the two are the same apart from the last 4 digits. The large panel's final digits are exactly 3x that of the small one, which seems to roughly correspond to the surface area ratio of the two panels. What the first numbers mean, I have no clue (roverdudes personal ID number?)
Nice find. Need to start up KSP.
Just random flavor text, folks ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) No mysteries

> 
> The numbers between the two are the same apart from the last 4 digits. The large panel's final digits are exactly 3x that of the small one, which seems to roughly correspond to the surface area ratio of the two panels. What the first numbers mean, I have no clue (roverdudes personal ID number?)

Interesting...

> 
> Just random flavor text, folks ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) No mysteries

Hmm, why is he/she winking, and that surface area thing seems to not fit with this...

I give this just a week or two before someone sets up an answering machine set up to one of those numbers with some snarky kerbalized response.

> 
> Just random flavor text, folks ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) No mysteries

That's what they want you to believe!

> 
> The numbers between the two are the same apart from the last 4 digits. The large panel's final digits are exactly 3x that of the small one, which seems to roughly correspond to the surface area ratio of the two panels. What the first numbers mean, I have no clue (roverdudes personal ID number?)

While every profile on the forums has a six digit ID number in the URL, the ID on Roverdude's profile does not match what's on the radiators. Below is a test of me putting it into [noparse][thread] and tags[/noparse] to see what happens.

Testing:

[thread=245907]thread[/thread]

post

EDIT:

thread takes you to a dead end.

post takes you to a post from 2012.
If you take the logical AND of the two sets of numbers and multiply by the result of the square root of the largest number you get the release date of Halflife 3.
I'll show my age and say I was expecting 867-5309.

> 
> I'll show my age and say I was expecting 867-5309.

:groan:
(10 chars)

(groan) Conspiracy theories abound... and are against the rules.

Next, you lot will be suggesting this or that landing coordinates actually proves that Minmus will explode on Scott Manley's birthday... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> (groan) Conspiracy theories abound... and are against the rules.
> Next, you lot will be suggesting this or that landing coordinates actually proves that Minmus will explode on Scott Manley's birthday... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I think that by conspiracy theories, squad doesn't mean joking about hidden meaning in-game. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

...!

I'm very glad some random person didn't have those phone numbers, because you people is freaking sick for calling them.

You don't go looking for random numbers in a freaking game to cold call!
And seriously... I make model numbers on texture text by mashing the keyboard (and in the case of the radiators, making sure the last four made sense between the two models).
Infinite monkeys on infinite keyboards...

8675309 appeared in Duke nukem 3d.

I don't know why I felt compelled to tell you that....

Called the number, E.T.'s mom picked up the phone.

E.T. If you read this, your mother wants you to phone home.

Stop running away kid, before Steven Spielberg makes another movie about your boring life...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T03:14:53Z" title="06/23/2015 03:14  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by Triop**
There was no Mun landing!
